text: the war has entered its second summer
and a year has passed since we first
drove down this road where men died in
the first battles and where they died
still
Shell's land but this is commonplace on
the high-speed drive into pesky where
the war never stops it's mostly the old
and the sick who left behind we were
staying with Svetlana h68
and with her husband who's the same age
who was named Anatoly is the beekeeper
of pesky tending the hive of his
neighbors who have fled I'm taking care
of them they're here
how can I just leave them the food that
they produce they share with elderly
neighbors the shops are too distant the
route too dangerous it's terrifying
before I had only a few gray hairs here
and now you can see when I look at
myself with my glasses on it's
terrifying and we're really fed up
because they don't let us go anywhere
there is no ceasefire here and coming
back to pesky I wondered why Anatoly and
Svetlana refused to leave just take a
look if I go to a city I will be under
shelling as well when I'm on my way
there somebody could shoot me or steal
my car anything can happen an utterly
did evacuate Svetlana to the city but
together since they were 16 separation
was too hard when he was alone here
every morning and evening we called each
other I had a strong pain in my soul and
so did he he was a lonely man here
because all the neighbors moved away can
I just ask you what does she mean to you
how can you abuse me to thurston as
majid how can I explain what she means
to me she's here
by night soldiers shoot up at the drones
that are scanning the ground for targets
near by the Ukrainians launch shells at
rebel positions
an utterly and Svetlana I've gone to bed
there asleep because for them this
utterly abnormal situation that's taking
place all around them is normal now
morning and time to check on an older
neighbor Sonia toll much over age 77 is
gathering fodder for her cow she lives
with her severely disabled son and says
there's nowhere else she can take him
don't be afraid I will not give you away
to anybody don't be afraid my little one
don't be afraid my baby
the politicians brought the country into
pieces this poor Ukraine just broken
into pieces but there are strong bonds
of love here in war you meet all kinds
of people what you are some of the
nicest people I've ever met and
certainly the bravest stay safe they
replied Anatoly and Svetlana keeping

Fredo Keene BBC News
